what: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: goal r2dii.colours provide easy access colours palettes created different research streams within 2DII.

title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: can install development version GitHub :

title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: r2dii.colours package can used retrieve 2DII colour palettes retieve hex codes particular colours palette. example, can retrieve 2DII plots colour palette use ’s ‘hex’ column define values ‘colour’ aesthetic ggplot (first two colours palette used line colours case).  can retrieve hex codes particular palette using get_colours function use specific colours (specific order) plot.
code: library(munsell) library(ggplot2) library(r2dii.colours) # The palette dataset palette_2dii_plot #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #>   label       hex     #>   <chr>       <chr>   #> 1 dark_blue   #1b324f #> 2 green       #00c082 #> 3 orange      #ff9623 #> 4 grey        #d0d7e1 #> 5 dark_purple #574099 #> 6 yellow      #f2e06e #> 7 soft_blue   #78c4d6 #> 8 ruby_red    #a63d57 #> 9 moss_green  #4a5e54  # Use dataset in your plot df2 <- data.frame(supp=rep(c("VC", "OJ"), each=3),                 dose=rep(c("D0.5", "D1", "D2"),2),                 len=c(6.8, 15, 33, 4.2, 10, 29.5))  ggplot(df2, aes(x = dose, y = len, group = supp, colour = supp)) +    geom_line() +   scale_colour_manual(values = palette_2dii_plot$hex) # Retrieve the colours in chosen order colours <- get_colours(   colour_names = c("green", "grey", "red"),    palette = palette_1in1000_goodbad   )  # Use colours in your plot ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = factor(cyl))) +    geom_point() +   scale_colour_manual(values = colours)

title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: colour palettes available r2dii.colours package displayed using munsell package convenient hex code colour display. colour labels please investigate palette datasets shown example .

title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: Extended organization colour palette can used plotting.  Sector colours (aligned PACTA interactive report).  Automotive sector technologies colour shades.  Power sector technologies colour shades.  Oil & gas sector technologies colour shades.  Fossil fuels sector technologies colour shades.  Scenario colours.

title: 2 Degrees Investing Colour Palettes in Different Formats
text: Extended colour palette can used plotting.  Colour palette can used differentiating ‘good’, ‘bad’ ‘neutral’ outcomes.  Official background colour.

what: Retrieve colour hex values from a palette — get_colours

text: Retrieve colour hex values palette

title: Retrieve colour hex values from a palette — get_colours
Retrieve colour hex values from a palette — get_colours
text: colour_names Character string vector character strings names colours want retrieve hex values. palette dataframe hex values retrieved. contain columns label hex.

title: Retrieve colour hex values from a palette — get_colours
text: vector strings hex codes order specified colour_names.

title: Retrieve colour hex values from a palette — get_colours
code: # use default palette get_colours(c("red", "blue")) #> [1] "#F53D3F" "#3d9bf5"  # specify which palette to use get_colours(c("red", "green"), palette = palette_1in1000_goodbad) #> [1] "#fa9e9f" "#CDFA9E"

what: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
title: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
text: custom discrete colour fill scales colours 2DII palettes.

title: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
code: scale_colour_2dii(   palette = c("2dii", "1in1000", "pacta"),   colour_groups = NULL,   ... )  scale_fill_2dii(   palette = c("2dii", "1in1000", "pacta"),   colour_groups = NULL,   ... )

title: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
text: palette String name colour scale used. specified general 2dii scale used colour_groups vector containing groups variable colours assigned. needed data assigned colour aesthetic contained colour aliases palette. ... parameters passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
text: object class "ScaleDiscrete".

title: Custom 2DII colour and fill scales — scale_colour_2dii
code: library(ggplot2, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(r2dii.plot, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)  sda %>% filter(emission_factor_metric == "projected") %>%  ggplot() +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = emission_factor_value, colour = sector)) +   scale_colour_2dii()   mpg %>%  ggplot() +   geom_histogram(aes(cyl, fill = class), position = "dodge", bins = 5) +   scale_fill_2dii()   sda %>% filter(emission_factor_metric == "projected") %>%  ggplot() +   geom_line(aes(x = year, y = emission_factor_value, colour = sector)) +   scale_colour_2dii(palette = "1in1000", colour_groups = sda$sector) #> Assigning colours to unrecognised names in data: automotive, aviation, cement, oil and gas, shipping, coal, steel.   market_share %>% filter(sector == "automotive", year %in% c(2020, 2025), metric == "projected") %>% ggplot() +  geom_bar(    stat = "identity",    aes(x = year, y = technology_share, fill = technology)) +  scale_fill_2dii(palette = "pacta")
